freenet.client.async
Class ClientPutter

java.lang.Object
  freenet.client.async.ClientRequester
      freenet.client.async.BaseClientPutter
          freenet.client.async.ClientPutter
All Implemented Interfaces:
PutCompletionCallback
public class ClientPutter
extends BaseClientPutter
implements PutCompletionCallback

A high level insert.

ClientPutter

public ClientPutter(ClientPutCallback client,
                    Bucket data,
                    FreenetURI targetURI,
                    ClientMetadata cm,
                    InsertContext ctx,
                    short priorityClass,
                    boolean getCHKOnly,
                    boolean isMetadata,
                    RequestClient clientContext,
                    SimpleFieldSet stored,
                    String targetFilename,
                    boolean binaryBlob)
Parameters:
client - The object to call back when we complete, or don't.
data - The data to insert. This will not be freed by ClientPutter, the callback must do that. However, buckets used internally by the client layer will be freed.
targetURI -
cm -
ctx -
scheduler -
priorityClass -
getCHKOnly -
isMetadata -
clientContext - The client object for purposs of round-robin client balancing.
stored - The progress so far, stored as a SimpleFieldSet. Advisory; if there is an error reading this in, we will restart from scratch.
targetFilename - If set, create a one-file manifest containing this filename pointing to this file.
Method Detail

start

public void start(boolean earlyEncode,
                  com.db4o.ObjectContainer container,
                  ClientContext context)
           throws InsertException
Start the insert.

Parameters:
earlyEncode - If true, try to find the final URI as quickly as possible, and insert the upper layers as soon as we can, rather than waiting for the lower layers. The default behaviour is safer, because an attacker can usually only identify the datastream once he has the top block, or once you have announced the key.
container - The database. If the insert is persistent, this must be non-null, and we must be running on the database thread. This is true for all methods taking a container parameter.
context - Contains some useful transient fields such as the schedulers.
Throws:
InsertException - If the insert cannot be started for some reason.

start

public boolean start(boolean earlyEncode,
                     boolean restart,
                     com.db4o.ObjectContainer container,
                     ClientContext context)
              throws InsertException
Start the insert.

Parameters:
earlyEncode - If true, try to find the final URI as quickly as possible, and insert the upper layers as soon as we can, rather than waiting for the lower layers. The default behaviour is safer, because an attacker can usually only identify the datastream once he has the top block, or once you have announced the key.
restart - If true, restart the insert even though it has completed before.
container - The database. If the insert is persistent, this must be non-null, and we must be running on the database thread. This is true for all methods taking a container parameter.
context - Contains some useful transient fields such as the schedulers.
Throws:
InsertException - If the insert cannot be started for some reason.

cancel

public void cancel(com.db4o.ObjectContainer container,
                   ClientContext context)
Cancel the insert. Will call onFailure() if it is not already cancelled, so the callback will normally be called.

Specified by:
cancel in class ClientRequester
Parameters:
container - The database. Must be non-null if the request or insert is persistent, in which case we must be on the database thread.
context - The ClientContext object including essential but non-persistent objects such as the schedulers.

public void onTransition(ClientPutState oldState,
                         ClientPutState newState,
                         com.db4o.ObjectContainer container)
Called when a ClientPutState transitions to a new state. If this is the current state, then we update it, but it might also be a subsidiary state, in which case we ignore it.

Specified by:
onTransition in interface PutCompletionCallback

                       ClientContext context)

onFetchable

public void onFetchable(ClientPutState state,
                        com.db4o.ObjectContainer container)
Called (sometimes) when enough of the data has been inserted that the file can now be fetched. Not very useful unless earlyEncode was enabled.

Specified by:
onFetchable in interface PutCompletionCallback

canRestart

public boolean canRestart()
Can we restart the insert?

restart

public boolean restart(boolean earlyEncode,
                       com.db4o.ObjectContainer container,
                       ClientContext context)
                throws InsertException
Restart the insert.

Parameters:
earlyEncode - See the description on @link start().
container - The database. If the insert is persistent, this must be non-null, and we must be running on the database thread. This is true for all places where we pass in an ObjectContainer.
Returns:
True if the insert restarted successfully.
Throws:
InsertException - If the insert could not be restarted for some reason.
